column2: In Agile development, what is a User Story
column4: A list of all bugs in the project
column5: A short description of functionality from the user's point of view
column6: A meeting agenda for the sprint

column2: SDFDS
column4: EDSFD
column5: DSFD

column2: Which artifact is typically produced in the Requirements phase?
column4: Class diagrams
column5: User manual

column2: Which of the following BEST describes Black-Box testing?
column3: Testing based on the internal implementation of the code
column4: Testing that focuses on inputs and outputs according to the specification
column5: Testing done only by the development team

column2: What is the goal of a Code Review?
column3: To rewrite the code from scratch
column4: To check coding style only
column5: To find defects and improve code quality before testing
column6: To measure the execution time of the code

column2: Which of the following is TRUE about White-Box testing?
column3: It ignores the internal structure of the code
column4: It is based on the GUI only
column5: It uses knowledge of the program's internal logic and paths
column6: It is always done by the customer

column2: In Scrum, who is mainly responsible for prioritizing items in the Product Backlog?
column4: Scrum Master
column5: Development Team

column2: Which review type is the MOST formal and usually has documented entry/exit criteria and roles?
column4: Inspection
column5: Pair programming

column2: What is the main purpose of UML Class Diagrams in architectural or detailed design?
column3: To describe how the GUI looks to the user
column4: To model classes their attributes methods and relationships
column5: To specify boundary values for test cases
column6: To show the project plan and schedule

column2: A JUnit test that checks the behavior of a single public method of a class is mainly considered:
column4: A system test
column5: An acceptance test

column2: In the context of stubs and drivers, a DRIVER is:
column3: A simple implementation of a called component (stub)
column4: A tool that monitors system performance like memory usage
column5: A test code that calls the component under test
column6: A database used for automated testing

column2: Which test design technique is MOST suitable to catch errors at the boundaries of input ranges?
column4: Boundary Value Analysis
column5: State Transition Testing

column2: In Agile, which statement about iterations (sprints) is MOST accurate?
column3: Iterations happen only after all requirements are finished
column4: Iterations are long phases with fixed scope
column5: Each iteration results in potentially shippable working software
column6: Testing is postponed until the last iteration

column2: Which of the following is NOT a typical benefit of Continuous Integration (CI)?
column4: Merge conflicts are reduced
column5: It removes the need for unit tests
column6: Build and test processes are automated

column2: During an Inspection, which role is responsible for moderating the meeting and keeping it on track?
column4: Author
column5: Moderator

column2: What is the main goal of architectural design (high-level design)?
column3: To optimize the GUI colors and fonts
column4: To define how system responsibilities are divided into components and their interactions
column5: To write detailed test cases

column2: Which metric BEST indicates that a JUnit test suite provides good structural coverage?
column3: High number of bugs found by customers
column4: High percentage of statements or branches executed during test run
column5: High number of GUI screens tested
column6: Low execution time of the tests

column2: You have a function that receives an integer and behaves differently in several ranges. Which combination gives the BEST functional coverage?
column4: Equivalence Partitioning plus Boundary Value Analysis
column5: State Transition Testing only
column6: Ad-hoc Testing by an expert tester

column2: A team maintains a large project using Git. Which workflow minimizes the risk of breaking the main branch?
column4: Use feature branches and pull requests with code review
column5: Use only one shared branch for all work
column6: Push code to a USB backup every day

column2: Which combination BEST describes the purpose of Acceptance Tests?
column3: Verify code style and naming conventions
column4: Verify that the system meets the customer's requirements
column5: Check that each class compiles without errors

column2: Which White-Box technique helps to systematically cover different logical combinations?
column4: Random functional tests
column5: Usability testing

column2: Which statement about Test-Driven Development (TDD) is MOST accurate?
column3: Tests are written after full implementation
column4: TDD encourages writing tests first and then code
column5: TDD eliminates the need for design completely
column6: TDD is used only for GUI testing

column2: A serious defect was found in production. What activity is MOST suitable to prevent recurrence?
column4: Performing root-cause analysis and improving test practices
column5: Asking developers to work faster
